GAMETES Genetic Architecture Model Emulator for Testing and Evaluating Software 2.2_dev (build 163) 2019/11/19 10:46

Institute for Biomedical Informatics, Perelman School of Medicine, University of Pennsylvania

Principal Investigator: Jason H. Moore, PhD

MDR requires Java 7 or above. You can get the latest version from Oracle

A java executable file is called a 'jar' file and ends with extension '.jar'.

You can download the MDR jar file to your computer from here: gametes_2.2_dev.jar.

Once Java is installed, double clicking on a jar file will launch the application.

Release notes

Sample data files:

MDR-SampleData.txt

MDR-SampleData-continuous-endpoints.txt

MDR is most often run with a graphical user interface (GUI).
It also can be run from the command line and supports a plethora of program parameters.
See ${mdr.command.line.help.file}.

For experienced users with larger analyses, there are a number of python scripts designed for use on a Torgue/Moab computer cluster. These scripts will create and submit jobs to the cluster. Once the jobs are complete, the user must re-run the script with the identical parameters and the results of the cluster jobs will be collated.
For splitting an analysis across multiple computers: large_file_on_cluster.py
For splitting permutations across multiple computers: permutations_on_cluster.py

A new feature in the development version of MDR is permutation testing in the GUI. See ${permutation.testing.html}.
